review: I have a Roku 3, which was the first Roku I purchased. It revolutionized my TV watching experience, and I would buy it again and again. I still use the Roku on our big TV in the family room. However we got a wall-mounted TV in the bedroom, and I decided to go with the stick to reduce clutter.The layout and overall feel of the Roku stick is the same as the Roku 3. However, if you want to have it be plug-free as I did, then you have to plug the power source into the USB of the TV. This means that when you turn on the TV, you have to wait for the Roku to boot up too. This takes maybe 60 seconds. A minor complaint.However the Roku stick is much slower than the Roku 3. It will take a few clicks on the remote before it actually registers, and screens take longer to load. I also feel like the shows occasionally stop and show the loading percentage, which does not happen on the Roku 3.The stick also does not have the headphone jack in the remote, which is a feature I use heavily on the Roku 3 as I work night shift and my boyfriend does not, so when I am up and about I can watch TV without bothering him. However we didn't really need this feature in the bedroom so that didn't matter too much.Overall, it works fine for a TV that we use less often, however if you were going to use this as your main device I would recommend the Roku 3.
